titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the John O. Koehler papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Jessica Lemieux

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-04-24T14:36-0700

change.item: April 22, 2015: Added reformatted sound recordings January 20, 2011: Updated date range, extent statement, and description to include new increment

physdesc.extent: 74 manuscript boxes, 1 oversize box, 3 card file boxes

did.abstract: Correspondence, news dispatches and news stories, photocopies of East German secret police documents, photocopies of United States government documents, post-reunification German governmental reports, clippings, other printed matter, photographs, sound recordings, and video tapes, relating to political conditions in Germany, the East German secret police, the attempted assassination of Pope John Paul II, and Soviet espionage within the Catholic Church. In part, used as research material for the books by J. O. Koehler, Stasi: The Untold Story of the East German Secret Police (Boulder, Colo., 1999), and Spies in the Vatican: The Soviet Union's War against the Catholic Church (2009).

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], John O. Koehler papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2001

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog Socrates at http://library.stanford.edu/webcat. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in Socrates is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

originalsloc.head: Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: This collection contains photocopies of documents in the Bundesbeauftragte für die Unterlagen des Staatssicherheitsdienstes der ehemaligen Deutschen Demokratischen Republik (BStU) and the United States National Archives and Records Administration.

chronitem.event: Freelance newsman for McGraw Hill Publications, Overseas Weekly, and Associated Press in Germany.
Sub-editor and reporter for Frankfurt bureau of Reuters.
Reporter for The Canadian Press, Vancouver, WA.
Reporter for United Press Association and British United Press, covering Vancouver, Winnipeg, and Seattle.
Covered, wrote and edited local news for the Anacortes American (Washington).

Served in the United States Army and United States Army Reserve, entering the Army as a corporal and holding the rank of captain when discharged. Assignments included intelligence collection, counter intelligence, criminal investigation, and public affairs.
Concurrent with Army service, reporter and editor for United Press Association in Phoenix, AZ.

AP Correspondent for 28 years, served as head of bureau in Bonn (1959-1962), chief correspondent in Berlin (1962-1965), and bureau chief for New Jersey (1965-1967). Also serves as deputy director and general manager for Personnel, and assistant general manager and managing director for the World Services Division at Associated Press headquarters in New York.
Assistant to the President and Director of Communications under Ronald Reagan.
Stasi: the Untold Story of the East German Secret Police is published by Westview Press.
Spies in the Vatican: the Soviet Union's War Against the Catholic Church is published by Perseus Books Group.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The collection documents John Koehler's career as a journalist, intelligence officer, and writer; it consists of correspondence, news stories, photocopies of East German and United States government documents, post-reunification German governmental reports, clippings, printed matter, photographs, sound recordings, and videotapes. Includes papers related to the Associated Press, the U.S. Army, political conditions in Germany, espionage, and especially the East German secret police. The bulk of the papers were collected by Koehler while researching and writing his book, entitled Stasi: The Untold Story of the East German Secret Police.

The Professional Files series includes news stories written by Koehler for the Associated Press (AP) and other news organizations, many of them dating from his time as chief correspondent in Berlin, and it also includes speeches and lectures given about journalism. Additionally, the Professional Files contain a small amount of material relating to the U.S. Army, Koehler's consulting company, and his work as President Reagan's communications director. The Correspondence series records Koehler's duties at the AP, particularly after he began working in the AP administrative offices in the United States. The Photographs series is mainly composed of AP photographs from Koehler's time as a reporter, depicting escapes from East Germany as well as photographs of Koehler himself.

The Stasi Research Materials series comprises the bulk of the collection. In the course of writing Stasi: the Untold Story of the East German Secret Police, Koehler collected information from a wide variety of sources. Thus, the series includes photocopied records from the East German Ministry of State Security (MfS), interviews with former MfS officers and victims, post-reunification German government reports, photocopied documents from various United States government agencies, and an extensive subject file of clippings and published material. The series reflects Koehler's interest in MfS abuses of power and extensively documents international espionage, terrorism, and repression of the East German population during the Cold War.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into four series: Professional Files, 1946-1989; Correspondence, 1960-1997; Photographs, 1960-1979; and Stasi Research Materials, 1931-2002. The Stasi Research Material series is further divided into five subseries: German Democratic Republic State Security Ministry files, 1931-1993 [bulk 1952-1989]; Federal Republic of Germany reports, 1990-1998; United States government documents, 1943-1997; Interviews and broadcasts, 1991-1997; Subject Files, 1931-2002.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Jürgen Perduss collection, Hoover Institution Archives
GDR Oral History Project interviews, Hoover Institution Archives
Heinrich Bortfeldt interviews, Hoover Institution Archives
Christian Joppke papers, Hoover Institution Archives
Sozialistische Einheitspartei Deutschlands miscellaneous records, Hoover Institution Archives

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Consists of correspondence, clippings, notes, and news stories relating to Koehler's work for the U.S. Army, the Associated Press (AP), for his consulting company, and as President Reagan's communications director. Bulk of the series consists of clippings of news stories written by Koehler in the 1950s and 1960s.

did.unittitle: International Narcotic Enforcement Officers Association membership certificate,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes business and personal correspondence documenting Koehler's work as a journalist and writer. Correspondence labeled personal contains both incoming and outgoing letters and documents Koehler's work managing the AP in the Personnel and World Service departments, his travels and attendance at social functions, discussions with fellow journalists, the inception of his book research. Also includes letters from victims of the Stasi.

did.unittitle: Stasi Victims - Helga and Günther Jahn,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Consists of photographs and negatives relating to Koehler's work for the Associated Press and on his research. Includes photographs of the Berlin Wall, escapes from East Germany, and of Koehler himself in action as a reporter. Many of the photographs are personal copies of AP photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains clippings, photocopies of East German State Security Ministry (Stasi) documents, post-reunification German government reports, photocopies of United States government documents, and audio and video recordings of interviews conducted by Koehler in the course of his research for Stasi: the Untold Story of the East German Secret Police.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: This series is arranged in five subseries: German Democratic Republic State Security Ministry files, 1931-1993 [bulk 1952-1989]; Federal Republic of Germany reports, 1990-1998; United States government documents, 1943-1997; Interviews and Broadcasts, 1991-1997; Subject files, 1931-2002.

did.unittitle: East German State Security Ministry Files,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photocopies of documents produced by the East German Ministry for State Security (Stasi). Original documents are held by the Bundesbeauftragte für die Unterlagen des Staatssicherheitsdienstes der ehemaligen Deutschen Demokratischen Republik (BStU). Four broad topics (identified by the archivist) are present in the files: international espionage and counterespionage, general Stasi operations, surveillance and repression, and terrorism.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Koehler's subject-oriented folder titles and thematic organization have been maintained, though folders with similar titles have been grouped to aid research. Where folder titles did not already exist, the archivist has supplied the Stasi Chief Department (Hauptabteilung) that produced the records, document number and a brief description of their contents.

did.unittitle: Hauptabteilung II and XX (Surveillance and Informants' reports),
IM Akte A/Teil II (Leipzig Informants' Reports),
Hauptabteilung VI no. C118/81 (Analysis of Political Operations),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Reports, transcripts, press releases, and scholarly articles produced in post-reunification Germany, primarily by the government. Includes articles regarding the process of reunification. Primarily documents the criminal investigation of Stasi activities and resulting trials. Also includes reports summarizing East German government structure and methodology. The agency producing the report has been noted in parenthesis in many cases.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, reports, and photocopies obtained via FOIA request from various U.S. government agencies including the Army, Air Force, Navy, FBI and CIA. Includes documents regarding the Stasi, terrorism, defectors, and the Cold War.

did.unittitle: U.S. Penetration of East German Government,
Report of the Vice President's Task Force on Combatting Terrorism,
U.S. Military defectors to East Germany,
Americans Who Spied Against their Country since World War II,
Conference on Cold War Military Records and History,
Criminal Complaint against James Michael Clark,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes transcripts, audiotapes and videotapes regarding the Stasi. Videotapes include news broadcasts and documentaries about the Stasi and Erich Mielke. Audiotapes record interviews conducted by Koehler in the course of his research. Interviewees include Stasi victims, former officers, German government officials, and Joachim Gauck.

scopecontent.p: Koehler conducted this interview over the telephone. At times the sound quality is poor due to telephone noise and tape hiss from the cassette.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: West German documentary made for training domestic counterintelligence officers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains clippings, notes, and printed material related to Koehler's research. Documents East German repression of its citizens, terrorism, counterintelligence, international relations, and dissidents. Several broad topics (identified by the archivist) are present in the files: international espionage and counterespionage, general Stasi operations, surveillance and repression, terrorism, reunification, and printed materials.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Original subject order was maintained during processing, though folders with similar titles have been grouped to aid research.
